intro: Eschweilera juruensis, commonly known as the Juruense palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically found in Brazil, Peru, and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits. Eschweilera juruensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
